newsitem.title: USA: Aristech to boost phenol capacity.
newsitem.headline: Aristech to boost phenol capacity.

text.p: Aristech Chemical Corp, a unit of Mitsubishi Corp, said on Wednesday it has approved a project to boost the company's phenol capacity by 10 percent.
The planned modification to Aristech's Haverhill, Ohio, facility will result in an additional 70 million pounds of production capability, Aristech said.
Aristech's capacity to produce acetone and alpha methyl styrene (AMS) will also be expanded, the company said.
Aristech said the project is slated to be completed in the fourth quarter of 1997, with full commercial operation scheduled for early 1998.
Also, Aristech said it has hired M.W. Kellogg to study the feasibility of a third phenol plant at the Haverhill site.
If approved, the third unit would start-up in 1999, coinciding with projections for market requirements, Aristech said.
